    <span id="ctl00_MainContent_DetailedOutput"><h1 class="title">Shemhazian (Mutilation Demon)</h1>Shemhazians rise from the souls of torturers and those who reveled in mutilating the physical bodies of their victims. Standing 35 feet tall, a shemhazian is well equipped with a wide range of talons, claws, and fangs to continue inflicting such torments on those it encounters.<br /><br /> Shemhazians delight in visiting torment upon mortals, of course, but more than most demons, these fiends revel in sharing the pain with their own kind. Other demons fear and hate shemhazians for this reason, with only the most powerful willing to work with a shemhazian to achieve a shared goal. Even then, the shemhazian is always on the watch for an opportunity to bring pain and suffering to its allies along with any foe.<br /><br /><b><u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5&General=true">Recall Knowledge - Fiend</a></u> (<u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=13">Religion</a></u>)</b>: DC 35<h1 class="title"><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=102">Shemhazian</a><span style="float:right;">Creature 16</span></h1><a target="_blank" href="Images\Monsters\Demon_Shemhazian.png"><img class="thumbnail" src="Images\Monsters\Demon_Shemhazian.png"></a><span alt="Chaotic Evil" class="traitalignment" title="Chaotic Evil">CE</span><span alt="Gargantuan" class="traitsize" title="Gargantuan">Gargantuan</span><span alt="Demon Trait" class="trait" title="A family of fiends, demons hail from or trace their origins to the Abyss. Most are irredeemably chaotic evil and have darkvision."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=42">Demon</a></span><span alt="Fiend Trait" class="trait" title="Creatures that hail from or have a strong connection to the evil-aligned planes are called fiends. Fiends can survive the basic environmental effects of planes in the Outer Sphere."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=70">Fiend</a></span><br /><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01y0m?Pathfinder-Bestiary" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Bestiary pg. 80</i></a><br /><b>Perception</b> +30; darkvision, scent (imprecise) 60 feet, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=344"><i>true seeing</i></a><br /><b>Languages</b> <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=12"><u>Abyssal</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=16"><u>Celestial</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=2"><u>Draconic</a></u>; telepathy 100 feet<br /><b>Skills</b> <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=3"><u>Athletics</a></u> +31, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5"><u>Deception</a></u> +25, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=7"><u>Intimidation</a></u> +27, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=9"><u>Medicine</a></u> +28, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=13"><u>Religion</a></u> +30<br /><b>Str</b> +9, <b>Dex</b> +5, <b>Con</b> +7, <b>Int</b> +0, <b>Wis</b> +6, <b>Cha</b> +3<hr /><b>AC</b> 39, <b>Fort</b> +32, <b>Ref</b> +26, <b>Will</b> +27; +1 status to all saves vs. magic<br /><b>HP</b> 350; <b>Weaknesses</b> cold iron 15, good 15<br /><b>Paralyzing Gaze</b> (<a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=206">aura</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=48">divine</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=61">enchantment</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=163">visual</a>) 30 feet. A non-evil creature that ends its turn in the aura must attempt a DC 35 Fortitude save. If it fails, it’s slowed 1 for 1 round, and if it critically fails, it is instead paralyzed for 1 round.<br /> <b>Succor Vulnerability</b> A shemhazian’s mutilation is a part of them, and they can’t bear to see it reversed. The first time each round that a creature heals from damage the shemhazian dealt on their last turn, the demon takes 3d6 mental damage.<br /> <b>Tail Whip</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Reaction" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\Reaction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Reaction" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\Reaction_I.png"> <b>Trigger</b> A creature within reach of the shemhazian’s tail leaves a square during a move action it’s using. <b>Effect</b> The shemhazian attempts to Trip the triggering creature. On a success, the creature also takes damage as if the shemhazian had hit with a tail Strike, and if the creature was flying, it falls 30 feet.<hr /><b>Speed</b> 35 feet, climb 20 feet, fly 35 feet (from <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=125"><i>fly</i></a>)<br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> jaws +33 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=64"><u>evil</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=103"><u>magical</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=192"><u>reach 20 feet</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 3d12+17 piercing plus 1d6 evil and enfeebling bite</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> claw +33 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=170"><u>agile</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=64"><u>evil</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=103"><u>magical</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=192"><u>reach 20 feet</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 3d8+17 slashing plus 1d6 evil</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> pincer +33 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=64"><u>evil</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=103"><u>magical</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=192"><u>reach 20 feet</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 3d8+17 bludgeoning plus 1d6 evil and Improved Grab</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> tail +33 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=64"><u>evil</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=103"><u>magical</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=192"><u>reach 30 feet</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 3d6+17 slashing plus 1d6 evil</span><b>Divine Innate Spells</b> DC 37; <b>8th</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=82">divine decree</a></u></i> (evil only); <b>5th</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=69">dimension door</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=239">prying eye</a></u></i> (x3); <b>4th</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=40">clairvoyance</a></u></i> (x3), <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=69">dimension door</a></u></i> (at will); <b>2nd</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=164">invisibility</a></u></i> (at will); <b>Constant</b> <b>(7th)</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=125">fly</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=344">true seeing</a></u></i><br /><b>Divine Rituals</b> DC 36; <b>1st</b> <i><u><a href="Rituals.aspx?ID=21">abyssal pact</a></u></i><br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Enfeebling Bite</b> (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=48"><u>divine</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=117"><u>necromancy</a></u>) If the shemhazian’s jaws Strike damages a creature, the target is <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=13">enfeebled 3</a>. The target can attempt a DC 37 Fortitude save to reduce this to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=13">enfeebled 1</a> (or be unaffected on a critical success).</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Focused Gaze</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png">  (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=32"><u>concentrate</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=48"><u>divine</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=61"><u>enchantment</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=93"><u>incapacitation</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=163"><u>visual</a></u>) The shemhazian focuses their gaze on a non-evil creature they can see within 30 feet. If that creature isn’t already slowed by the shemhazian’s paralyzing gaze, it must attempt a save against the shemhazian’s paralyzing gaze. If that creature is <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=35">slowed</a>, it must succeed at a DC 35 Fortitude save or be <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=28">paralyzed</a> for 1 round. A shemhazian can’t use this ability against the same creature more than once per round.</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Rend</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png">  claw</span><h2 class="title">All Monsters in "<a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=28">Demon</a>"</h2><table class="inner"><tr><td><b>Name</b></td><td><b>Level</b></td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=104">Balor (Fire Demon)</a></td><td>20</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=101">Glabrezu (Treachery Demon)</a></td><td>13</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=455">Kalavakus (Slaver Demon)</a></td><td>10</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=103">Marilith (Pride Demon)</a></td><td>17</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=481">Nalfeshnee (Boar Demon)</a></td><td>14</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=97">Quasit</a></td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=102">Shemhazian (Mutilation Demon)</a></td><td>16</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=98">Succubus (Lust Demon)</a></td><td>7</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=100">Vrock (Wrath Demon)</a></td><td>9</td></tr></table><h1 class="title"><a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=28">Demon</a></h1><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01y0m?Pathfinder-Bestiary" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Bestiary pg. 76</i></a><br />When a sinful mortal soul is judged and sent on to the Abyss, it can become a deadly fiend—a demon. Demons are living incarnations of sin—be they classic sins like wrath or gluttony, or more “specialized” depravities like an obsession with torture or the act of treason or treachery. Once formed, a demon’s driving goals are twofold—the amassing of personal power, and the corruption of mortal souls to cause them to become tainted by sin. In this way demons ensure a never-ending supply of new demons to bolster their ever-growing ranks in the Abyss.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Additional Lore" title="Sidebar - Additional Lore" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png"> Demonic Deities</h3>The most powerful demons are known as demon lords (the term is gender neutral in this case). Of these divinities, Lamashtu is the most powerful. Countless other demon lords exist, including Abraxas, Cyth-V’sug, Kabriri, and Zura.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Locations" title="Sidebar - Locations" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_3_Locations.png"> Demonic Locations</h3>The sprawling, heaving, changing realm of the Abyss is the planar home of demonic life, but demons can be found anywhere the capacity to sin exists. Evil or foolish conjurers are fond of calling upon demons for advice or darker needs. When the Abyss wears through the boundaries of reality to create wound-like portals into other worlds, demons can spill over to wreak incredible havoc.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Additional Lore" title="Sidebar - Additional Lore" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png"> Demonic Possession</h3>Some demons specialize in the art of possessing creatures or objects to spread fear and chaos. In such cases a demon gains a powerful disguise with which to work its evils upon the world, a subterfuge that delights the demon.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Additional Lore" title="Sidebar - Additional Lore" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png"> Demonic Sources</h3>When a sinful mortal soul is consigned to the Abyss, it spends time wallowing in the mire and feeding on filth. If it survives and is not itself eaten, the soul eventually ascends into a demon, as influenced by the nature of its sin, yet most demons are themselves capable of reproduction as well. The fecundity of demonic life is perhaps the greatest—and most threatening—aspect of these dangerous fiends.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Related Creatures" title="Sidebar - Related Creatures" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_4_RelatedCreatures.png"> Other Demons</h3>The Abyss may be the largest of the Outer Planes, and mortals have an equally large capacity to betray themselves, society, and the natural order of reality. With this limitless source for increasingly specialized sins, the Abyss is constantly generating new types of demons to plague reality. While the vast majority of these are swiftly destroyed and never rise again, enough survive that dozens, if not hundreds, of types of demons are known to exist beyond those listed here. The shadowy invidiak is a demon without a body, born of envious souls. The goat-faced, flame-hooved brimorak rises from the souls of arsonists. Slimy, horned blood demons spawn from assassins, boar demons from the greedy... the list goes on and on.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Additional Lore" title="Sidebar - Additional Lore" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png"> Sinful Destruction</h3>While they enjoy causing destruction themselves, most demons prefer to trick and tempt mortals into falling to sin of their own volition.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Additional Lore" title="Sidebar - Additional Lore" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png"> The Nature of Chaos</h3>Some say that the nature of chaos inherently precludes cooperation and subtlety, but demons are proof of the fallacy of this claim.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Additional Lore" title="Sidebar - Additional Lore" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png"> What Makes a Sin?</h3>Some classify sin into seven categories—envy, gluttony, greed, lust, pride, sloth, and wrath. While these sins embody some of the most powerful and numerous demons, far more than seven demons exist. Any act of cruelty or destruction a mortal takes to gratify the self at others’ expense is, in effect, a sin, and any such act can spawn a demon from a soul in the afterlife.</span>

  <script>
      initiateToggle(document.getElementById('theme-toggle'));
      initializeMenuToggle(document.getElementById('minMaxMenu'));
      var initializeSearch = function (search) {
          var button;
          var text;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.lastElementChild;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.lastElementChild;

          if (search) {
              search.addEventListener('keypress', function (e) {
                  if (e.keyCode == 13) {
                      e.preventDefault();
                      if (text.value != null && text.value.length > 0)
                          window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
                  }
              })
          }
          if (button) {
              button.addEventListener('click', function (e) {
                  window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
              });
          }
      };
      var initializeExpand = function (toggle) {
          var targetAttrString = "[data-target='" + toggle.dataset.toggle + "']";
          //target = menu to be collapsed
          var target = document.querySelector(targetAttrString);
          toggle.addEventListener('click', function () {
              var expanded = target.classList.contains('expanded');
              expanded = !expanded;
              if (expanded) {
                  //hide other in group if exists
                  if (target.dataset.group) {
                      var otherExpanded = document.querySelector('.expanded[data-group="' + target.dataset.group + '"]');
                      if (otherExpanded) {
                          otherExpanded.classList.remove('expanded');
                      }
                  }
                  target.classList.add('expanded');
              } else {
                  target.classList.remove('expanded');
              }
          });
      };
      (function () {
          //toggles = link that expands/collapses target
          var toggles = document.querySelectorAll('[data-toggle]');
          toggles.forEach(function (toggle) {
              initializeExpand(toggle);
          });
          //searches
          var searches = document.querySelectorAll('.search');
          searches.forEach(function (search) {
              initializeSearch(search);
          });
      })();
  </script>
